summary: This document is Ghislaine Maxwell's application for a second U.S. passport, submitted in March 2003. It includes the application form, a detailed travel itinerary to Israel, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia, and a supporting letter from Jeffrey Epstein on behalf of LSJ, LLC, stating her need for a second passport to avoid conflicting visa stamps.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Passport Applicant, Executive of LSJ, LLC
persons.context: The primary applicant for a second U.S. passport, citing extensive international travel for business with LSJ, LLC. Her application includes a detailed itinerary.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Wrote a letter of support for Ghislaine Maxwell's application for a second passport, stating her business travel requirements.

persons.name: Kimberly Smith
persons.context: Listed as the sales person who booked Maxwell's travel itinerary via American Express Centurion Travel Service.

persons.name: Helen Kim
persons.context: Appears as the recipient of an email containing the travel itinerary, though the email states replies are not accepted.

connections.description: Epstein, as Managing Member of LSJ, LLC, writes a letter supporting Maxwell's passport application, indicating she is an executive of the company.
Smith, a salesperson for American Express, booked Maxwell's complex international travel itinerary.

events.title: Maxwell's Scheduled Business Trip Departure
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to depart on a business trip to Israel, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia.

events.title: Passport Application Submission
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell write letters in support of her application for a second U.S. passport.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell applied for a second U.S. passport in March 2003, citing business travel for LSJ, LLC.
Jeffrey Epstein, as Managing Member of LSJ, LLC, wrote a formal letter of support for her application.
The stated reason for needing a second passport was to avoid conflicting visa stamps, specifically an Israeli stamp preventing entry into Jordan and Saudi Arabia.
A detailed itinerary shows Maxwell was booked to travel from New York to Tel Aviv, then to Amman and Riyadh, before returning via London and Paris in March 2003.
The application form lists Maxwell's permanent address as being in New York, NY.
